prompt_planning:
### User Instruction ###
Check the top 3 trending news on "X". Read a few posts to figure out what's happening. And create a new Note to summarize your findings.

---
Think step by step and make an high-level plan to achieve the user's instruction. If the request is complex, break it down into subgoals. If the request involves exploration, include concrete subgoals to quantify the investigation steps. The screenshot displays the starting state of the phone.

### Available Shortcuts from Past Experience ###
We additionally provide some shortcut functionalities based on past experience. These shortcuts are predefined sequences of operations that might make the plan more efficient. Each shortcut includes a precondition specifying when it is suitable for use. If your plan implies the use of certain shortcuts, ensure that the precondition is fulfilled before using them. Note that you don't necessarily need to include the names of these shortcuts in your high-level plan; they are provided as a reference.
- Tap_Type_and_Enter: Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation. Very useful for searching and sending messages! | Precondition: There is a text input box on the screen with no previously entered content.

---
Provide your output in the following format which contains three parts:

### Thought ###
A detailed explanation of your rationale for the plan and subgoals.

### Plan ###
1. first subgoal
2. second subgoal
...

### Current Subgoal ###
The first subgoal you should work on.
raw_response:
### Thought ###
To complete the task, I need to check the top 3 trending news topics on the "X" app, read a few posts to understand the context, and summarize the findings in a new note. The process involves navigating to the "X" app, identifying trending topics, exploring posts related to the top 3 trends, and then creating a note in the Notes app to summarize the findings.

### Plan ###
1. Open the "X" app.
2. Navigate to the "Trending" section to identify the top 3 trending topics.
3. Read a few posts for each of the top 3 topics to understand the context.
4. Exit the "X" app and open the Notes app.
5. Create a new note summarizing the findings from the trending topics.

### Current Subgoal ###
Open the "X" app.

### Tips ###
From previous experience interacting with the device, you have collected the following tips that might be useful for deciding what to do next:
0. Do not add any payment information. If you are asked to sign in, ignore it or sign in as a guest if possible. Close any pop-up windows when opening an app.
1. By default, no APPs are opened in the background.

No important notes recorded.

---
Carefully examine all the information provided above and decide on the next action to perform. If you notice an unsolved error in the previous action, think as a human user and attempt to rectify them. You must choose your action from one of the atomic actions or the shortcuts. The shortcuts are predefined sequences of actions that can be used to speed up the process. Each shortcut has a precondition specifying when it is suitable to use. If you plan to use a shortcut, ensure the current phone state satisfies its precondition first.

#### Atomic Actions ####
The atomic action functions are listed in the format of `name(arguments): description` as follows:
- Open_App(app_name): If the current screen is Home or App screen, you can use this action to open the app named "app_name" on the visible on the current screen.
- Tap(x, y): Tap the position (x, y) in current screen.
- Swipe(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2). To swipe up or down to review more content, you can adjust the y-coordinate offset based on the desired scroll distance. For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
- Enter(): Press the Enter key after typing (useful for searching).
- Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
- Back(): Return to the previous state.
- Home(): Return to home page.
- Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.
NOTE: Unable to type. The keyboard has not been activated. To type, please activate the keyboard by tapping on an input box or using a shortcut, which includes tapping on an input box first.”

#### Shortcuts ####
The shortcut functions are listed in the format of `name(arguments): description | Precondition: precondition` as follows:
- Tap_Type_and_Enter(x, y, text): Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation. Very useful for searching and sending messages! | Precondition: There is a text input box on the screen with no previously entered content.

---
Provide your output in the following format, which contains three parts:
### Thought ###
Provide a detailed explanation of your rationale for the chosen action. IMPORTANT: If you decide to use a shortcut, first verify that its precondition is met in the current phone state. For example, if the shortcut requires the phone to be at the Home screen, check whether the current screenshot shows the Home screen. If not, perform the appropriate atomic actions instead.

### Action ###
Choose only one action or shortcut from the options provided. Do NOT return invalid actions like null or stop. Use shortcuts whenever possible to expedite the process, but make sure that the precondition is met.
You must provide your decision using a valid JSON format specifying the name and arguments of the action. For example, if you choose to tap at position (100, 200), you should write {"name":"Tap", "arguments":{"x":100, "y":100}}. If an action does not require arguments, such as Home, fill in null to the "arguments" field. Ensure that the argument keys match the action function's signature exactly.

### Description ###
A brief description of the chosen action and the expected outcome.

- Tap(x, y): Tap the position (x, y) in current screen.
- Swipe(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2). To swipe up or down to review more content, you can adjust the y-coordinate offset based on the desired scroll distance. For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
- Enter(): Press the Enter key after typing (useful for searching).
- Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
- Back(): Return to the previous state.
- Home(): Return to home page.
- Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.

The atomic action functions are listed in the format of `name(arguments): description` as follows:

- Tap(x, y): Tap the position (x, y) in current screen.
- Swipe(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2). To swipe up or down to review more content, you can adjust the y-coordinate offset based on the desired scroll distance. For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
- Enter(): Press the Enter key after typing (useful for searching).
- Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
- Back(): Return to the previous state.
- Home(): Return to home page.
- Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.
NOTE: Unable to type. The keyboard has not been activated. To type, please activate the keyboard by tapping on an input box or using a shortcut, which includes tapping on an input box first.”

#### Atomic Actions ####
The atomic action functions are listed in the format of `name(arguments): description` as follows:
- Open_App(app_name): If the current screen is Home or App screen, you can use this action to open the app named "app_name" on the visible on the current screen.
- Tap(x, y): Tap the position (x, y) in current screen.
- Swipe(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2). To swipe up or down to review more content, you can adjust the y-coordinate offset based on the desired scroll distance. For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
- Enter(): Press the Enter key after typing (useful for searching).
- Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
- Back(): Return to the previous state.
- Home(): Return to home page.
- Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.
NOTE: Unable to type. The keyboard has not been activated. To type, please activate the keyboard by tapping on an input box or using a shortcut, which includes tapping on an input box first.”

icon: The app logo is a square with rounded corners, filled with orange-red color inside, and there's a gray pencil mark on it.
icon: The PDF document add/edit button has a white square with a green checkmark on it, outlined in black.
icon: The icon is composed of three horizontal lines stacked on top of each other, with black lines against a white background.
icon: The icon is rectangular and has black letters on a white background.

icon: The Wi-Fi symbol is a circle with three horizontal lines inside, while the signal strength indicator is a vertical line that's thicker at the bottom than the top. Both symbols have white outlines on a transparent background.
icon: The icon is a white circle with two black lines forming an "X" shape, representing Wi-Fi disconnection or no internet connection.
icon: The time icon on the phone screen has a white background with black text displaying "3:32".
icon: The icon is circular, white with black border, and has two lines representing time on it.
icon: The icon has three vertical lines, each with two horizontal dashes below it, all within a square bounding box. The background is white while the lines and dashes are black.
icon: The icon is shaped like three horizontal lines with the topmost line being shorter than the other two, and it's black on white background.
icon: The icon is rectangular with rounded corners, white in color, and depicts a speaker symbol with sound waves emanating from it.
icon: The number three, rendered in black within a white circle with rounded corners on a gray background.
icon: The icon is square-shaped with rounded corners, featuring a white background and orange text that reads "Edit".

For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
Type(text): Type the "text" in an input box.
Enter(): Press the Enter key after typing (useful for searching).
Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
Back(): Return to the previous state.
Home(): Return to home page.
Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.

### Existing Tips from Past Experience ###
0. Do not add any payment information. If you are asked to sign in, ignore it or sign in as a guest if possible. Close any pop-up windows when opening an app.
1. By default, no APPs are opened in the background.
2. Screenshots may show partial text in text boxes from your previous input; this does not count as an error.
3. When creating new Notes, you do not need to enter a title unless the user specifically requests it.


### Existing Shortcuts from Past Experience ###
- Tap_Type_and_Enter(x, y, text): Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation. Very useful for searching and sending messages! | Precondition: There is a text input box on the screen with no previously entered content.
### Atomic Actions ###
Open_App(app_name): If the current screen is Home or App screen, you can use this action to open the app named "app_name" on the visible on the current screen.
Tap(x, y): Tap the position (x, y) in current screen.
Swipe(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2). To swipe up or down to review more content, you can adjust the y-coordinate offset based on the desired scroll distance. For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
Type(text): Type the "text" in an input box.
Enter(): Press the Enter key after typing (useful for searching).
Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
Back(): Return to the previous state.
Home(): Return to home page.
Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.
